result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean M Lameer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: STRAIGHT TIME. Huber privileges for work and/or school. Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HOC screening.

miscConds.notes:
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
* Obtain and maintain employment or school or vocational training.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law WITHIN ONE (1) YEAR, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

timeConds.notes: * Court ordered the defendant to serve THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction.  STAYED.  To be used at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sean M Lameer in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve NINETY (90) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for SIX (6) DAYS time served.  STRAIGHT TIME.  Huber privileges for work and/or school.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HoC screening.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of ONE (1) YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Court ordered the defendant to serve THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction.  STAYED.  To be used at agent's discretion.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain and maintain employment or school or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.  Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law WITHIN ONE (1) YEAR, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS OR FEES.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Sean M Lameer in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

WARRANT WAS NOT SUBMITTED TO MCSO.  CLERK DESTROYED WARRANT.

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Sean M Lameer in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State did not have their file.  Conference proceeded on the Record.  State moved to ADJOURN in light of the fact that they do not have their file.  Defense did NOT object.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 6-07-16
Bench warrant in file.

Defendant Sean M Lameer in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Sean M Lameer in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer for Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Matter before the Court to address JusticePoint violation.  On Motion of the State, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
JusticePoint DPA Non-compliance Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Sean M Lameer in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Based upon Defendant's compliance, Court adjourns matter to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

COURT VACATES STAYED BENCH WARRANT ISSUED 09-08-2015.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report. Filed sdg.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant in residential treatment.  Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Review hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement report, received and filed. cmt

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.

All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Sean M Lameer in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 7/13/15 @ 10:00am
